Document.author: dennis
Document.document: Translation updates

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: - Only use typedefs inside their scope. - Variables that are out of scope, were not removed all the time. - Make a varchar NULL set everything to 0 when not using indicators. - Synced parser.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: - Only use typedefs inside their scope. - Variables that are out of scope, were not removed all the time. - Make a varchar NULL set everything to 0 when not using indicators.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix bogus line break within a file name, as noted by Alvaro.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix some bogus code in ConstBit production --- it managed to work, but only because 14627 still contained the same node that BitWithoutLength had just produced. Make it more transparent. Also adjust ConstCharacter to be coded the same way for consistency.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove some no-longer-needed #includes.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Arrays can be read as arrays or as character strings now.

Document.author: teodor
Document.document: 1 Eliminate duplicate field HLWORD->skip 2 Rework support for html tags in parser 3 add HighlightAll to headline function for generating highlighted whole text with saved html tags

Document.document: Comma splice police

Document.document: Override upstream DSSSL style sheet formatting changes

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Override upstream DSSSL style sheet formatting changes

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Added SET DESCRIPTOR command. Note that this still has some bugs. The functionality is there though, it's just a matter of fixing the bugs now. Cleaned up error handling in preprocessor.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Revert mistaken #include change, per Merlin Moncure.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Nested transactions. There is still much left to do, especially on the performance front, but with feature freeze upon us I think it's time to drive a stake in the ground and say that this will be in 7.5. Alvaro Herrera, with some help from Tom Lane.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix seriously nasty memory leak in new TransactionIdIsInProgress code.

Document.author: joe
Document.document: Add double metaphone code from Andrew Dunstan. Also change metaphone so that an empty input string causes an empty output string to be returned, instead of throwing an ERROR -- per complaint from Aaron Hillegass, and consistent with double metaphone. Fix examples in README.soundex pointed out by James Robinson.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Removed unused variable and added a typecast.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Further review of xact.c state machine for nested transactions. Fix problems with starting subtransactions inside already-failed transactions. Clean up some comments.

Document.author: joe
Document.document: plperl update from Andrew Dunstan, deriving (I believe) from Command Prompt's plperlNG. Review and minor cleanup/improvements by Joe Conway. Summary of new functionality: - Shared data space and namespace. There is a new global variable %_SHARED that functions can use to store and save data between invocations of a function, or between different functions. Also, all trusted plperl function now share a common Safe container (this is an optimization, also), which they can use for storing non-lexical variables, functions, etc. - Triggers are now supported - Records can now be returned (as a hash reference) - Sets of records can now be returned (as a reference to an array of hash references). - New function spi_exec_query() provided for performing db functions or getting data from db. - Optimization for counting hash keys (Abhijit Menon-Sen) - Allow return of 'record' and 'setof record'

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: More paranoia in AtEOSubXact_SPI: don't assume we can safely use SPI_finish for cleaning up. It seems possible that the memory contexts SPI_finish would try to touch are already goneSEMICOLON and there's no need for SPI itself to delete them, since the containing contexts will surely be going away anyway at transaction end.

Document.author: joe
Document.document: Attached is a 1 line bug fix for dbmirror that was submitted. It fixes a bug where some transactions could be dropped when writing mirrored SQL statements to files. -- Steven Singer

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Translation update

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Translation update

Document.author: joe
Document.document: Andreas Pflug wrote: From an idea of Bruce, the attached patch implements the function pg_tablespace_databases(oid) RETURNS SETOF oid which delivers as set of database oids having objects in the selected tablespace, enabling an admin to examine only the databases affecting the tablespace for objects instead of scanning all of them. initdb forced

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add missing operators of the form interval-plus-datetime, as required for better SQL compliance in this area, per recent discussion. Mark related operators as commutators where possible. (The system doesn't actually care about commutator marking for operators not returning boolean, at the moment, but this seems forward-thinking and besides it made it easier to verify that we hadn't missed any.) Also, remove interval-minus-time and interval-minus-timetz operators. I'm not sure how these got in, but they are nonstandard and had very obviously broken behavior. (minus is not commutative in anyone's book.) I doubt anyone had ever used 'em, because we'd surely have gotten a bug report about it if so.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix no-longer-correct bit-pushing in TransactionIdSetStatus, per Alvaro.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Okay, I've had it with answering newbie questions about why plpgsql FOR loops are giving weird syntax errors. Restructure parsing of FOR loops so that the integer-loop-vs-query-loop decision is driven off the presence of '..' between IN and LOOP, rather than the presence of a matching record/row variable name. Hopefully this will make the behavior a bit more transparent.

Document.document: Made sure SET DESCRIPTOR accepts all data types including constants.

Document.document: Clarify schema meanings in pg_dump manual page by referring to object definitions more frequently.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Test HAVING condition before computing targetlist of an Aggregate node. This is required by SQL spec to avoid failures in cases like SELECT sum(win)/sum(lose) FROM ... GROUP BY ... HAVING sum(lose) > 0SEMICOLON AFAICT we have gotten this wrong since day one. Kudos to Holger Jakobs for being the first to notice.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Test HAVING condition before computing targetlist of an Aggregate node. This is required by SQL spec to avoid failures in cases like SELECT sum(win)/sum(lose) FROM ... GROUP BY ... HAVING sum(lose) > 0SEMICOLON AFAICT we have gotten this wrong since day one. Kudos to Holger Jakobs for being the first to notice.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix BSD-only coding in port.c (passing a local variable to putenv). Also a quick but half-baked attempt to make trim_trailing_separator do the right thing with path consisting only of '/' --- still needs work for Windows I think.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Check more test points (in fact, every week in 1970..2004) to get a more accurate matching of our time zone to the system's zone. This method is able to distinguish Antarctica/Casey from Australia/Perth, as in Chris K-L's recent exampleSEMICOLON and it is not materially slower than before, because the extra checks generally don't get done against very many time zones. It seems possible that with this test we'd be able to correctly identify Windows timezones without looking at the timezone name, but I do not have the ability to try it.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Defend against overrun of ExtraOptions array --- strictly paranoia, since the person or script starting the postmaster has to be trusted anyway.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Cause the format of BC timestamptz output to be 'datetime zone BC' rather than 'datetime BC zone', because the former is accepted by the timestamptz input converter while the latter may not be depending on spacing. This is not a loss of compatibility w.r.t. 7.4 and before, because until very recently there was never a case where we'd output both zone and 'BC'.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Use standard macro for psql binary file open. Add comment explaining control-z requirement.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Rename XLOG_BTREE_NEWPAGE xlog record type into XLOG_HEAP_NEWPAGE, and shift support code into heapam.c accordingly. This is in service of soon-to-be-committed ALTER TABLE SET TABLESPACE code that will want to use this same record type for both heaps and indexes. Theoretically I should have forced initdb for this, but in practice there is no change in xlog contents because CVS tip will never really emit this record type anyhow...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Move TablespaceCreateDbspace() call into smgrcreate(), which is where it probably should have been to begin withSEMICOLON this is to cover cases like needing to recreate the per-db directory during WAL replay. Also, fix heap_create to force pg_class.reltablespace to be zero instead of the database's default tablespaceSEMICOLON this makes the world safe for CREATE DATABASE to handle all tables in the default tablespace alike, as per previous discussion. And force pg_class.reltablespace to zero when creating a relation without physical storage (eg, a view)SEMICOLON this avoids possibly having dangling references in this column after a subsequent DROP TABLESPACE.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove TABLESPACE option of CREATE SEQUENCESEMICOLON sequences will now always live in database or schema's default tablespace, as per today's discussion. Also, remove some unused keywords from the grammar (PATH, PENDANT, VERSION), and fix ALSO, which was added as a keyword but not added to the keyword classification lists, thus making it worse-than-reserved.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: win32 doesn't support a static initializer for mutexes, thus the first user must initialize the lock. The problem are concurrent "first" users - the pthread_mutex_t initialization must be synchronized. The current implementation is broken, the attached patches fixes that: mutex_initlock is a spinlock. If the pthread_mutex_t mutex is not initialized, then the spinlock is acquired, if the pthread_mutex_t is initialized if it's not yet initialized and then the spinlock is dropped. Manfred Spraul

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Back out thread fix until I get clarification.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: > win32 doesn't support a static initializer for mutexes, thus the first > user must initialize the lock. The problem are concurrent "first" users > - the pthread_mutex_t initialization must be synchronized. > The current implementation is broken, the attached patches fixes that: > mutex_initlock is a spinlock. If the pthread_mutex_t mutex is not > initialized, then the spinlock is acquired, if the pthread_mutex_t is > initialized if it's not yet initialized and then the spinlock is dropped. Manfred Spraul

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The attached patch, which incorporates the previous one sent and currently unapplied regarding spi_internal.c, makes some additional fixes relating to return types, and also contains the fix for preventing the use of insecure versions of Safe.pm. There is one remaing return case that does not appear to work, namely return of a composite directly in a select, i.e. if foo returns some composite type, 'select * from foo()' works but 'select foo()' doesn't. We will either fix that or document it as a limitation. The function plperl_func_handler is a mess - I will try to get it cleaned up (and split up) in a subsequent patch, time permitting. Also, reiterating previous advice - this changes slightly the API for spi_exec_query - the returned object has either 2 or 3 members: 'status' (string) and 'proceesed' (int,- number of rows) and, if rows are returned, 'rows' (array of tuple hashes). Andrew Dunstan

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: This patch adds the following options to pg_dumpall, to be passed to pg_dump: -S, --superuser=NAME -O, --no-owner -X disable-dollar-quoting, --disable-dollar-quoting -X disable-triggers, --disable-triggers Christopher Kings-Lynne

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Cause libpq and ecpg libraries to be built as proper shared libraries (.dylib format) on Mac OS X, while not messing up loadable modules for the backend (which are the same kind of animal as a shared library on every other platform, but not here). Also get the naming convention to match OS X practice, viz libFOO.version.so not libFOO.so.version. In support of that last, refactor code in Makefile.shlib to make it easier to have platform-specific shlib naming conventions. This patch is loosely based on the Fink project's current postgresql.patch. Tested by yours truly on OS X 10.3.4SEMICOLON does anyone have 10.2.* to check it on?

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Change pg_dump to use ALTER OWNER commands instead of SET SESSION AUTHORIZATION commands by default. Move all GRANT and REVOKE commands to the end of the dump to avoid restore failures in several situations. Bring back --use-set-session-authorization option to get previous SET behaviour Christopher Kings-Lyne

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Here is a patch required to build plperl with win32. The issues were: * perl_useshrplib gets set to "yes" and not to "true". I assume it's set to "true" on unix, so I left both. * Need to translate backslashes into slashes * The linker config coming out of perl was for MSVC and not for mingw Magnus Hagander

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Invent ResourceOwner mechanism as per my recent proposal, and use it to keep track of portal-related resources separately from transaction-related resources. This allows cursors to work in a somewhat sane fashion with nested transactions. For now, cursor behavior is non-subtransactional, that is a cursor's state does not roll back if you abort a subtransaction that fetched from the cursor. We might want to change that later.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > o Enforce rules for setting combinations

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix broken markup, per Jonathan Gardner.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: When renaming a column that participates in a foreign key, we must force relcache rebuild for the other table as well as the column's own table. Otherwise, already-cached foreign key triggers will stop working. Per example from Alexander Pravking.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: When renaming a column that participates in a foreign key, we must force relcache rebuild for the other table as well as the column's own table. Otherwise, already-cached foreign key triggers will stop working. Per example from Alexander Pravking.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Rename AC_PROG_LD* macros to PGAC_PROG_LD*. This avoids clashes with the macros provided by the real libtool, when other packages borrow some macros from PostgreSQL, as in the case of the ODBC driver.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: XLOG file archiving and point-in-time recovery. There are still some loose ends and a glaring lack of documentation, but it basically works. Simon Riggs with some editorialization by Tom Lane.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove unportable use of strptime() to parse recovery target time spec. Instead use our own abstimein code, which is more flexible anyway.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix incorrect tracking of session authorization in the presence of ACLs that contain rights granted by non-owners. Per bug report from Nishad Prakash.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix incorrect tracking of session authorization in the presence of ACLs that contain rights granted by non-owners. Per bug report from Nishad Prakash.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Here is another patch that fixes a stack of pg_dump bugs: * Fix help text ordering * Add back --set-session-authorization to pg_dumpall. Updated the docs for that. Updated help for that. * Dump ALTER USER commands for the cluster owner ("pgsql"). These are dumped AFTER the create user and create database commands in case the permissions to do these have been revoked. * Dump ALTER OWNER for public schema (because it's possible to change it). This was done by adding TOC entries for the public schema, and filtering them out at archiver time. I also save the owner in the TOC entry just for the public schema. * Suppress dumping single quotes around schema_path and DateStyle options when they are set using ALTER USER or ALTER DATABASE. Added a comment to the steps in guc.c to remind people to update that list. * Fix dumping in --clean mode against a pre-7.3 server. It just sets all drop statements to assume the public schema, allowing it to restore without error. * Cleaned up text output. eg. Don't output -- Tablespaces comment if there are none. Same for groups and users. * Make the commands to DELETE FROM pg_shadow and DELETE FROM pg_group only be output when -c mode is enabled. I'm not sure why that hasn't been done before?!?! This should be good for application asap, after which I will start on regression dumping 7.0-7.4 databases. Christopher Kings-Lynne

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Invent WAL timelines, as per recent discussion, to make point-in-time recovery more manageable. Also, undo recent change to add FILE_HEADER and WASTED_SPACE records to XLOGSEMICOLON instead make the XLOG page header variable-size with extra fields in the first page of an XLOG file. This should fix the boundary-case bugs observed by Mark Kirkwood. initdb forced due to change of XLOG representation.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add missing <getopt.h>, per Dann Corbit.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Avoid default: followed by no statement, per Dann Corbit.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Still another try at automatically detecting the best match in the zic timezone database for the system behavior we find ourselves in. Scan backwards from current time and choose the zone that matches furthest back. As per discussion a week or so back.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Done: > * -Have psql show more information about sequences

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Updated wording: > * Have psql show current values for a sequence

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add a check on file size as an additional safety check that a WAL file recovered from archive is not corrupt. It's not much but it will catch one common problem, viz out-of-disk-space. Also, force a WAL recovery scan when recovery.conf is present, even if pg_control shows a clean shutdown. This allows recovery with a tar backup that was taken with the postmaster shut down, as per complaint from Mark Kirkwood.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add cross-check that current timeline of pg_control is an ancestor of recovery_target_timeline --- otherwise there is no path from the backup to the requested timeline. This check was foreseen in the original discussion but I forgot to implement it.

Document.author: momjian

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add some more logging to simplify diagnosis of problems in IDENT authorization. Inspired by problem report from Ian Pilcher.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix oversight: in case where SIGTERM is received while there are live backends, the archiver and stats processes never got sent a kill signal. They'd eventually exit on their own, but not for awhile, which is a bit annoying when you are trying to replace the executable file on a platform that doesn't allow removal of busy executables. Also, tweak main loop logic so that we will perform the background tasks after select() returns EINTR.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update tuple header size.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Replace nested-BEGIN syntax for subtransactions with spec-compliant SAVEPOINT/RELEASE/ROLLBACK-TO syntax. (Alvaro) Cause COMMIT of a failed transaction to report ROLLBACK instead of COMMIT in its command tag. (Tom) Fix a few loose ends in the nested-transactions stuff.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Translation updates

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Allow borland compiles.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Suppress readline usage in mingw in configure.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Invent ResourceOwner mechanism as per my recent proposal, and use it to keep track of portal-related resources separately from transaction-related resources. This allows cursors to work in a somewhat sane fashion with nested transactions. For now, cursor behavior is non-subtransactional, that is a cursor's state does not roll back if you abort a subtransaction that fetched from the cursor. We might want to change that later.

Document.author: joe
Document.document: plperl update from Andrew Dunstan, deriving (I believe) from Command Prompt's plperlNG. Review and minor cleanup/improvements by Joe Conway. Summary of new functionality: - Shared data space and namespace. There is a new global variable %_SHARED that functions can use to store and save data between invocations of a function, or between different functions. Also, all trusted plperl function now share a common Safe container (this is an optimization, also), which they can use for storing non-lexical variables, functions, etc. - Triggers are now supported - Records can now be returned (as a hash reference) - Sets of records can now be returned (as a reference to an array of hash references). - New function spi_exec_query() provided for performing db functions or getting data from db. - Optimization for counting hash keys (Abhijit Menon-Sen) - Allow return of 'record' and 'setof record'

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Here is a patch required to build plperl with win32. The issues were: * perl_useshrplib gets set to "yes" and not to "true". I assume it's set to "true" on unix, so I left both. * Need to translate backslashes into slashes * The linker config coming out of perl was for MSVC and not for mingw Magnus Hagander

Document.document: Fix trim_trailing_separator() to not trim c:BACKSLASH nor BACKSLASHBACKSLASHnetworkBACKSLASH on Win32.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Check more test points (in fact, every week in 1970..2004) to get a more accurate matching of our time zone to the system's zone. This method is able to distinguish Antarctica/Casey from Australia/Perth, as in Chris K-L's recent exampleSEMICOLON and it is not materially slower than before, because the extra checks generally don't get done against very many time zones. It seems possible that with this test we'd be able to correctly identify Windows timezones without looking at the timezone name, but I do not have the ability to try it.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: > win32 doesn't support a static initializer for mutexes, thus the first > user must initialize the lock. The problem are concurrent "first" users > - the pthread_mutex_t initialization must be synchronized. > The current implementation is broken, the attached patches fixes that: > mutex_initlock is a spinlock. If the pthread_mutex_t mutex is not > initialized, then the spinlock is acquired, if the pthread_mutex_t is > initialized if it's not yet initialized and then the spinlock is dropped. Manfred Spraul

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: win32 doesn't support a static initializer for mutexes, thus the first user must initialize the lock. The problem are concurrent "first" users - the pthread_mutex_t initialization must be synchronized. The current implementation is broken, the attached patches fixes that: mutex_initlock is a spinlock. If the pthread_mutex_t mutex is not initialized, then the spinlock is acquired, if the pthread_mutex_t is initialized if it's not yet initialized and then the spinlock is dropped. Manfred Spraul

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove TABLESPACE option of CREATE SEQUENCESEMICOLON sequences will now always live in database or schema's default tablespace, as per today's discussion. Also, remove some unused keywords from the grammar (PATH, PENDANT, VERSION), and fix ALSO, which was added as a keyword but not added to the keyword classification lists, thus making it worse-than-reserved.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Cause the format of BC timestamptz output to be 'datetime zone BC' rather than 'datetime BC zone', because the former is accepted by the timestamptz input converter while the latter may not be depending on spacing. This is not a loss of compatibility w.r.t. 7.4 and before, because until very recently there was never a case where we'd output both zone and 'BC'.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The attached patch, which incorporates the previous one sent and currently unapplied regarding spi_internal.c, makes some additional fixes relating to return types, and also contains the fix for preventing the use of insecure versions of Safe.pm. There is one remaing return case that does not appear to work, namely return of a composite directly in a select, i.e. if foo returns some composite type, 'select * from foo()' works but 'select foo()' doesn't. We will either fix that or document it as a limitation. The function plperl_func_handler is a mess - I will try to get it cleaned up (and split up) in a subsequent patch, time permitting. Also, reiterating previous advice - this changes slightly the API for spi_exec_query - the returned object has either 2 or 3 members: 'status' (string) and 'proceesed' (int,- number of rows) and, if rows are returned, 'rows' (array of tuple hashes). Andrew Dunstan

Also, undo recent change to add FILE_HEADER and WASTED_SPACE records to XLOGSEMICOLON instead make the XLOG page header variable-size with extra fields in the first page of an XLOG file. This should fix the boundary-case bugs observed by Mark Kirkwood. initdb forced due to change of XLOG representation.

Document.document: This patch fixes a small error in the Porting PL/SQL to PL/pgSQL section where a instr function parameter is mistyped as varchar. It works properly when changed to integer. Michael Glaesemann

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Test HAVING condition before computing targetlist of an Aggregate node. This is required by SQL spec to avoid failures in cases like SELECT sum(win)/sum(lose) FROM ... GROUP BY ... HAVING sum(lose) > 0SEMICOLON AFAICT we have gotten this wrong since day one. Kudos to Holger Jakobs for being the first to notice.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Test HAVING condition before computing targetlist of an Aggregate node. This is required by SQL spec to avoid failures in cases like SELECT sum(win)/sum(lose) FROM ... GROUP BY ... HAVING sum(lose) > 0SEMICOLON AFAICT we have gotten this wrong since day one. Kudos to Holger Jakobs for being the first to notice.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: More paranoia in AtEOSubXact_SPI: don't assume we can safely use SPI_finish for cleaning up. It seems possible that the memory contexts SPI_finish would try to touch are already goneSEMICOLON and there's no need for SPI itself to delete them, since the containing contexts will surely be going away anyway at transaction end.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add a check on file size as an additional safety check that a WAL file recovered from archive is not corrupt. It's not much but it will catch one common problem, viz out-of-disk-space. Also, force a WAL recovery scan when recovery.conf is present, even if pg_control shows a clean shutdown. This allows recovery with a tar backup that was taken with the postmaster shut down, as per complaint from Mark Kirkwood.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Detect locale/encoding mismatch in initdb, or pick a suitable encoding automatically if none was specified.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add OSX thread support for next 7.4.X

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add comment describing ereport() NOTICE/WARNING distinction.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Okay, I've had it with answering newbie questions about why plpgsql FOR loops are giving weird syntax errors. Restructure parsing of FOR loops so that the integer-loop-vs-query-loop decision is driven off the presence of '..' between IN and LOOP, rather than the presence of a matching record/row variable name. Hopefully this will make the behavior a bit more transparent.

Document.author: joe
Document.document: Andreas Pflug wrote: From an idea of Bruce, the attached patch implements the function pg_tablespace_databases(oid) RETURNS SETOF oid which delivers as set of database oids having objects in the selected tablespace, enabling an admin to examine only the databases affecting the tablespace for objects instead of scanning all of them. initdb forced

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Formatting improvements: < The most recent version of this document can be viewed at < the PostgreSQL web site, http://www.PostgreSQL.org. > The most recent version of this document can be viewed at the PostgreSQL web site, http://www.PostgreSQL.org.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add missing operators of the form interval-plus-datetime, as required for better SQL compliance in this area, per recent discussion. Mark related operators as commutators where possible. (The system doesn't actually care about commutator marking for operators not returning boolean, at the moment, but this seems forward-thinking and besides it made it easier to verify that we hadn't missed any.) Also, remove interval-minus-time and interval-minus-timetz operators. I'm not sure how these got in, but they are nonstandard and had very obviously broken behavior. (minus is not commutative in anyone's book.) I doubt anyone had ever used 'em, because we'd surely have gotten a bug report about it if so.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix obsolete comment.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Here is another patch that fixes a stack of pg_dump bugs: * Fix help text ordering * Add back --set-session-authorization to pg_dumpall. Updated the docs for that. Updated help for that. * Dump ALTER USER commands for the cluster owner ("pgsql"). These are dumped AFTER the create user and create database commands in case the permissions to do these have been revoked. * Dump ALTER OWNER for public schema (because it's possible to change it). This was done by adding TOC entries for the public schema, and filtering them out at archiver time. I also save the owner in the TOC entry just for the public schema. * Suppress dumping single quotes around schema_path and DateStyle options when they are set using ALTER USER or ALTER DATABASE. Added a comment to the steps in guc.c to remind people to update that list. * Fix dumping in --clean mode against a pre-7.3 server. It just sets all drop statements to assume the public schema, allowing it to restore without error. * Cleaned up text output. eg. Don't output -- Tablespaces comment if there are none. Same for groups and users. * Make the commands to DELETE FROM pg_shadow and DELETE FROM pg_group only be output when -c mode is enabled. I'm not sure why that hasn't been done before?!?! This should be good for application asap, after which I will start on regression dumping 7.0-7.4 databases. Christopher Kings-Lynne

Document.author: momjian

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix misspellings: langauge -> language.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix no-longer-correct bit-pushing in TransactionIdSetStatus, per Alvaro.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix oversight: in case where SIGTERM is received while there are live backends, the archiver and stats processes never got sent a kill signal. They'd eventually exit on their own, but not for awhile, which is a bit annoying when you are trying to replace the executable file on a platform that doesn't allow removal of busy executables. Also, tweak main loop logic so that we will perform the background tasks after select() returns EINTR.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The attached patch allows 'select foo()' as well as 'select * from foo()' where foo() is a plperl function that returns a single composite. Andrew Dunstan

Document.author: jurka
Document.document: When retrieving an array of numerics it attempted to set the scale on the retrieved data to zero, which doesn't work for non-integer values. Oliver Dauben

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix library_path with canonicalization.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Move comma.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update URL's for mysql conversion tools.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Use standard macro for psql binary file open. Add comment explaining control-z requirement.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Defend against overrun of ExtraOptions array --- strictly paranoia, since the person or script starting the postmaster has to be trusted anyway.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Adjust release notes based on community feedback.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Back out pg_autovacuum commit after cvs clean failure causes commit.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: XLOG file archiving and point-in-time recovery. There are still some loose ends and a glaring lack of documentation, but it basically works. Simon Riggs with some editorialization by Tom Lane.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Rename AC_PROG_LD* macros to PGAC_PROG_LD*. This avoids clashes with the macros provided by the real libtool, when other packages borrow some macros from PostgreSQL, as in the case of the ODBC driver.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Change pg_dump to use ALTER OWNER commands instead of SET SESSION AUTHORIZATION commands by default. Move all GRANT and REVOKE commands to the end of the dump to avoid restore failures in several situations. Bring back --use-set-session-authorization option to get previous SET behaviour Christopher Kings-Lyne

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Allow moving system tables to other tablespaces, where possible

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Move Win32 defines from port.h to win32.h.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Fix data types where equality comparison isn't intuitive, e.g. box

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Move TablespaceCreateDbspace() call into smgrcreate(), which is where it probably should have been to begin withSEMICOLON this is to cover cases like needing to recreate the per-db directory during WAL replay. Also, fix heap_create to force pg_class.reltablespace to be zero instead of the database's default tablespaceSEMICOLON this makes the world safe for CREATE DATABASE to handle all tables in the default tablespace alike, as per previous discussion. And force pg_class.reltablespace to zero when creating a relation without physical storage (eg, a view)SEMICOLON this avoids possibly having dangling references in this column after a subsequent DROP TABLESPACE.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Rename XLOG_BTREE_NEWPAGE xlog record type into XLOG_HEAP_NEWPAGE, and shift support code into heapam.c accordingly. This is in service of soon-to-be-committed ALTER TABLE SET TABLESPACE code that will want to use this same record type for both heaps and indexes. Theoretically I should have forced initdb for this, but in practice there is no change in xlog contents because CVS tip will never really emit this record type anyhow...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Install recovery.conf.sample into the /share install directory.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: When renaming a column that participates in a foreign key, we must force relcache rebuild for the other table as well as the column's own table. Otherwise, already-cached foreign key triggers will stop working. Per example from Alexander Pravking.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: When renaming a column that participates in a foreign key, we must force relcache rebuild for the other table as well as the column's own table. Otherwise, already-cached foreign key triggers will stop working. Per example from Alexander Pravking.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Cause libpq and ecpg libraries to be built as proper shared libraries (.dylib format) on Mac OS X, while not messing up loadable modules for the backend (which are the same kind of animal as a shared library on every other platform, but not here). Also get the naming convention to match OS X practice, viz libFOO.version.so not libFOO.so.version. In support of that last, refactor code in Makefile.shlib to make it easier to have platform-specific shlib naming conventions. This patch is loosely based on the Fink project's current postgresql.patch. Tested by yours truly on OS X 10.3.4SEMICOLON does anyone have 10.2.* to check it on?

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove postgresql.conf of 'info' as a valid client_min_messages level.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: file fr.po was initially added on branch REL7_4_STABLE.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Avoid default: followed by no statement, per Dann Corbit.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add missing <getopt.h>, per Dann Corbit.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Move tablespace name up on to the same line in psql BACKSLASHd.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add tablespace location display for psql BACKSLASHd. Gavin Sherry

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Tablespace examples for CREATE TABLE/INDEX/SCHEMA/DATABASE as well as some other examples for CREATE DATABASE. Gavin Sherry
